bill_title: make an appropriation to the state library to support information literacy skills.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation to the state library to support information literacy skills. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the state general fund the sum of eighty thousand dollars ($80,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the state library to be used to improve the information literacy skills of students, to provide professional development in information literacy skills for librarians and teachers, to assist library staff in developing library collection and services in support of curriculum, to assist school librarians with the selection of automation systems to make resources easier to locate, to disseminate information regarding current and evolving issues in school library management and instructional practice, and to provide training guidance in evaluating library programs and services to successfully achieve school library media standards. Section 2. The state librarian shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2006, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
